thread.title: Durant scores 23, Thunder roll past Nuggets, 111-98
thread.title_full: Durant scores 23, Thunder roll past Nuggets, 111-98

author: wtopstaff
title: Durant scores 23, Thunder roll past Nuggets, 111-98
text:
Home » News » Sports » NBA » Durant scores 23, Thunder… Durant scores 23, Thunder roll past Nuggets, 111-98 By CLIFF BRUNT October 18, 2015 9:35 pm Oklahoma City Thunder forward Kevin Durant (35) gestures in the first quarter of a preseason NBA basketball game against the Denver Nuggets in Oklahoma City, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/Sue Ogrocki) 
OKLAHOMA CITY (AP) — Kevin Durant scored 23 points to help the Oklahoma City Thunder beat the Denver Nuggets 111-98 on Sunday night. 
Durant played 32 minutes, the most action he’s had since coming back from a broken foot that cost him most of last season. He shot 9 of 14 and had six rebounds. 
Rookie Emmanuel Mudiay scored 22 points for the Nuggets. 
NUGGETS: Danilo Gallinari and Erick Green each scored 16 points. 
THUNDER: G Dion Waiters scored 17 points. … C Steven Adams was poked in the eye in the third quarter, left the game and did not return. … C Enes Kanter had 18 points and 11 rebounds before fouling out. 
STAR WATCH: Thunder G Russell Westbrook had 17 points, 12 assists and five rebounds. 
MIDSEASON FORM: Thunder F Serge Ibaka scored 18 points on 7-for-8 shooting. 
UP NEXT: Denver visits Utah on Thursday; Oklahoma City visits Utah on Tuesday. Topics:
